lead_paragraph: Officials said the attacker, Mohamed Lahouaiej Bouhlel, may have “radicalized himself very quickly.” Four of his acquaintances have been detained.

byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Nice, and Aurelien Breeden from Paris. Reporting was contributed by Lilia Blaise from Nice, Rukmini Callimachi from New York, Benoît Morenne from Paris, and Nour Youssef from Cairo.
byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and AURELIEN BREEDEN

headline.print_headline: Islamic State Claims Responsibility for Terrorist Attack in Nice
headline.main: ISIS Claims Truck Attacker in France Was Its ‘Soldier’

snippet: Officials said the attacker, Mohamed Lahouaiej Bouhlel, may have “radicalized himself very quickly.” Four of his acquaintances have been detained....
abstract: Islamic State takes credit for fatal attack in Nice, France, claiming Mohamed Lahouaiej Bouhlel was one of group's 'soldiers', though no evidence has emerged to confirm assertion; four of Bouhlel's acquaintances are detained as country begins three days of national mourning.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
